page.title: 09FARM LIFE IN LLANBISTER
page.content: The average day starts at around 8am, after breakfast. The chickens are fed and are put out onto grass for the day, some of these birds provide eggs, others are for the table.Cows are brought into the shed to milk for the house and are then put out to grass. mucking out is also a daily chore,the manure is kept to help fertilize the fields. In summer hay or silage making takes up most of the time,the aim being to store enough feed to carry the stock through the winter. During the winter the suckling of calves and the feeding of all stock is an every day routine.They are fed on hay, silage or oat straw.Growing stock are given cube cake. Spare time is taken up maintaining hedges and fences,machinery and buildings.
